alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 29 at 8:37PM CST until January 29 at 11:30PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Lincoln County in south central Mississippi... Franklin County in southwestern Mississippi... * Until 1130 PM CST. * At 837 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brookhaven, Bude, Mccall Creek, New Hope, Caseyville, Vaughn, Kirby, Loyd Star, Garden City and Meadville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
